thread.title: Easy for Farragut in first round of district
thread.title_full: Easy for Farragut in first round of district

title: Easy for Farragut in first round of district
text:
Soccer: Farragut cruises to opening round victory News Sentinel staff 10:32 PM, Oct 10, 2015 Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
Aleyse Evers posted a hat trick and an assist as Farragut High School's girls soccer team cruised in the opening round of the District 4-AAA tournament with a 9-0 victory over William Blount on Saturday. 
The host Lady Admirals scored six second-half goals to secure their advancement to Tuesday's semifinals against Hardin Valley. 
Evers scored two goals and posted the assist in the final period. Erin VanHoozier scored two goals, Eryn Hill scored a goal and had two assists and Megan McLean posted a goal and an assist for Farragut. 
Bearden 11, Heritage 0: Casey Riemer scored five first-half goals and Taylor Frizen added two as the Lady Bulldogs cruised in the first round. 
Bearden will play host to the winner of Sunday's Maryville-West game on Monday. 
Hardin Valley 4, Lenoir City 0: Macy Lindsey, Regan Ely, Gabby Powers and Addison Beyer scored goals for the Lady Hawks. 
District 3-AAA 
Halls 2, Gibbs 0: Taylor Grabner and Mackenzie Brantley each scored goals as Halls shut out Gibbs. 
Grabner's goal came in the first half, and Brantley's came off a corner kick from Grabner in the second. 
The Red Devils (10-5) advance to Tuesday's semifinal match against Oak Ridge. 
Karns 2, Anderson County 0: The Lady Beavers outshot the Lady Mavericks 12-3 to advance to Tuesday's semifinal at Powell. 
District 2-A/AA 
Northview Academy 1, Claiborne 0: Lainey Floyd scored on an assist from Jessica Bentley in extra time as the Lady Cougars (3-14) advanced to Monday's 6 p.m. semifinal at Greeneville. 
East/Middle Region 
District I 
Webb 9, Mt. Juliet Christian 0: Darby Bauman had four goals and Abby Bailey added two goals and two assists as the Lady Spartans advanced to Tuesday's 5 p.m. championship match against Donelson Christian Academy, a 6-0 winner over The King's Academy. 
Volleyball 
East/Middle Region 
Tournament MVP Nicklin Hames of Webb totaled 16 points, 17 kills, 27 digs and 24 assists as the Lady Spartans beat both Friendship Christian and Zion Christian in straight sets to win a region championship. No teams were eliminated during the tournament. Webb will host a substate game next Saturday. The King's Academy, which fell in four sets to both Zion and Friendship, will travel on Saturday. Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
